legacyPatterns.description: Legacy ASP.NET MVC framework needs migration to ASP.NET Core MVC/Razor Pages
legacyPatterns.impact: Complete rewrite of web layer required

legacyPatterns.description: WCF is not supported in .NET Core/.NET 5+. Must migrate to gRPC, REST API, or other communication pattern
MSMQ is Windows-only and not suitable for containers. Must migrate to Azure Service Bus, RabbitMQ, or other message broker
System.Web.Mvc, System.Web.Optimization, and related assemblies not available in .NET Core
In-memory session state (Session["Cart"]) needs distributed cache for container scenarios
Old-style .csproj format with packages.config instead of SDK-style with PackageReference
Application startup in Global.asax.cs needs migration to Program.cs/Startup.cs pattern
XML configuration needs migration to appsettings.json and environment variables
Razor views largely compatible but need syntax updates for ASP.NET Core

legacyPatterns.impact: Docker configuration required for Azure Container Apps

modernizationRequirements.requirement: Convert ASP.NET MVC 5 to ASP.NET Core MVC
Replace WCF with REST API or gRPC
Replace MSMQ with Azure Service Bus or similar cloud-native solution
Implement distributed cache (Redis) for session state
Migrate Web.config to appsettings.json and environment variables
Create Azure Container Apps deployment manifests
Update all NuGet packages to .NET 10 compatible versions

complexity.justification: High complexity due to multiple major architectural changes: (1) ASP.NET MVC to ASP.NET Core migration requiring significant code changes, (2) WCF to modern API pattern requiring service layer redesign, (3) MSMQ to cloud message broker requiring infrastructure change, (4) Session state distribution for containers, (5) Three separate projects requiring coordination. The application has moderate size and complexity in business logic, but the technology stack changes are substantial.

phases.name: Foundation & Infrastructure
tasks: Update all dependencies to .NET 10 compatible versions

phases.name: Service Layer Modernization
tasks: Replace WCF ProductServiceLibrary with ASP.NET Core Web API
Implement REST endpoints for product operations
Update ProductCatalog to consume REST API instead of WCF

phases.name: Web Application Migration
tasks: Migrate ASP.NET MVC controllers to ASP.NET Core MVC
Update Razor views for ASP.NET Core syntax
Migrate bundling and minification to modern approach

phases.name: Message Queue Migration
tasks: Replace MSMQ with Azure Service Bus
Update OrderQueueService to use Azure Service Bus SDK
Migrate OrderProcessor to Azure Service Bus consumer

phases.name: Containerization & Deployment
tasks: Set up container registry and CI/CD

phases.name: Testing & Validation
tasks: Load testing on Azure Container Apps

risks.risk: WCF to REST API migration may reveal tight coupling
risks.mitigation: Start with simple REST API wrapper around existing logic

risks.risk: MSMQ to Azure Service Bus message format compatibility
risks.mitigation: Maintain message serialization format or implement adapter pattern

risks.risk: Session state distribution complexity in containers
risks.mitigation: Use Azure Redis Cache with session middleware

risks.risk: Breaking changes in ASP.NET Core MVC from MVC 5
risks.mitigation: Follow official migration guides and test incrementally
Use Azure Container Apps built-in service discovery

benefits.maintainability: Modern framework with better tooling and community support
benefits.cloudNative: Azure Container Apps provides managed infrastructure with auto-scaling
benefits.crossPlatform: Can run on Linux containers for cost efficiency
benefits.modernDevelopment: Access to latest C# features and .NET capabilities

recommendations: Start with WCF to REST API migration as it's the most critical architectural change
Use Azure Service Bus instead of custom MSMQ implementation for better cloud integration
Implement Redis distributed cache from the start for proper container support
Consider using minimal APIs for the product service for simplicity
Use Azure Container Apps environment variables for configuration
Implement health checks for all services
Set up Application Insights for monitoring
Use managed identity for Azure service authentication
